q: Piers Morgan Tonight, the shock jock calls the NBC late-night host`` insane'' and accuses him of stealing sketch ideas. Jay Leno is a crook and the world knows exactly what he's up to. He steals a tremendous amount of material, The New York Post quoted Stern as saying.`` This guy's ripped off like 10 major things from my show.'' Stern also adds he's baffled that Jay Leno has beaten fellow late-night host David Letterman

an interview with The Wall Street Journal, Google's chief executive, Eric Schmidt , predicted that in the future, people will be automatically entitled to change their names upon adulthood to escape the hijinks of their youth. I don't believe society understands what happens when everything is available, knowable and recorded by everyone all the time, he said. Op het matje Donald Rumsfeld vertrok uiteindelijk twee jaar later, een dag na de tussentijdse Congresverkiezingen in de VS, waarbij de Republikeinse partij van president President Bush gevoelige klappen opliep. Ik had al besloten dat ik niet zou blijven als de Democraten de macht in het Congres zouden overnemen , schrijft de oud-minister. Donald Rumsfeld voorzag dat hij om de haverklap op het matje zou worden geroepen bij een Democratisch Congres.`` Dit betekende dat het tijd was om sommige mensen te vervangen.''

billion, or 67pc while revenues from outside of the United States totaled US$ 4.38 billion, representing 52pc of total revenues.`` Q4 marked a terrific end to a stellar year,'' said Eric Schmidt . Our strong performance has been driven by a rapidly growing digital economy, continuous product innovation that benefits both users and advertisers, and by the extraordinary momentum of our newer businesses, such as display and mobile. These results give us the optimism and confidence to invest heavily in future growth- investments that will benefit our users, Google and the wider web. Google changes its management structure While Eric Schmidt will step down as CEO he will assume the role of executive chairman focusing on deals, partnerships and broader business relationships as well as advising founders Larry Page
